item.title: Aukus: China denounces US-UK-Australia pact as irresponsible
item.description: The alliance will allow Australia to build and deploy nuclear-powered submarines for the first time.

item.title: Aukus: UK, US and Australia pact signals Asia-Pacific power shift
item.description: The agreement will increase Western presence in the region, amid concerns about China's growing influence.

item.title: Afghanistan's singers flee Taliban violence
item.description: The BBC spoke with six singers who crossed to Pakistan illegally and are now living in hiding.

item.title: Aukus: What will nuclear-powered submarines mean for Australia?
item.description: Australia's deal with the UK and US puts it in an exclusive club, but an expert says it's "risky bet".

item.title: Afghanistan: Life under Taliban rule one month on
item.description: Secunder Kermani looks at life in northern Afghanistan, four weeks after the militants seized power.

item.title: Indonesia president found negligent over Jakarta filthy air
item.description: The Indonesian capital is among the worst air polluted cities in the world.

item.title: US general defends 'secret' phone calls with China
item.description: Gen Mark Milley allegedly phoned Beijing to "reassure" them amid concern about President Trump.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban deputy denies reports of leadership row in new video
item.description: Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar had disappeared from view amid reports of a row between Taliban leaders.

item.title: Afghanistan women's youth soccer team escapes to Pakistan
item.description: Their departure comes as part of a wider exodus of female stars after the Taliban takeover.

item.title: North and South Korea test ballistic missiles hours apart
item.description: The tests highlight an arms race on the peninsula, as nuclear talks with North Korea remain stalled.

item.title: Australia's Curtin University wants 'unethical' AI study retracted
item.description: The Australian university says the facial recognition study co-funded by China breached guidelines.

item.title: #MeToo: China court dismisses landmark sex harassment case
item.description: It ruled there was insufficient evidence that a prominent TV host had sexually harassed his intern.

item.title: Australian bandicoot brought back from brink of extinction
item.description: The small furry Eastern Barred Bandicoot is bumped off an Australian "extinct in the wild" list.

item.title: Curious bears crash football game in India
item.description: The 'guests' showed some dribbling skills before disappearing into the forest with the ball.

item.title: Hong Kong: Activists jailed for joining banned Tiananmen vigil
item.description: Nine activists are sentenced for joining a banned vigil last year commemorating the 1989 massacre.

item.title: Covid: The lives upended by Australia's sealed border
item.description: Eighteen months after Australia shut its border, people reveal tales of separation and despair.

item.title: Pakistan: How to cool Karachi as temperatures rise
item.description: In Karachi, Pakistan, one entrepreneur is on a mission to plant urban forests to cope with rising temperatures.

item.title: Mangrove forests: Photography winners show beauty of ecosystems
item.description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

item.title: When Nazis tried to trace Aryan race myth in Tibet
item.description: Heinrich Himmler sent a team of five Germans to Tibet in 1938 to pursue the Aryan race myth.

item.title: The homemakers breaking taboos on Instagram
item.description: Vasanti, Ritu and Pradnya, who have overcome huge challenges, now find joy performing on Instagram.

item.title: China's Covid-driven surfing boom
item.description: Coronavirus restrictions limiting foreign travel lead to a boom in people riding the waves in China.

item.title: Afghan women hit back at Taliban with #DoNotTouchMyClothes campaign
item.description: Afghan women show off their traditional dress as black burqas spread under the Taliban.

item.title: World War Two: The forgotten Indian soldiers of Dunkirk
item.description: Some 300 Indian soldiers were evacuated from the coast of France during a pivotal moment in World War Two.

item.title: Why North Korea keeps launching missiles
item.description: North Korea keeps testing missiles despite international condemnation. Why does Pyongyang persist?

item.title: India appointed three top women judges. Is it too early to celebrate?
item.description: Appointment of three women to India's Supreme Court is being hailed as a "historic moment".

item.title: The Taliban are back â€“ will al-Qaeda follow?
item.description: Where is al-Qaeda 20 years after the 9/11 attacks - and could it re-emerge as a terror threat?

item.title: Why is there a food emergency in Sri Lanka?
item.description: With a weak economy and a challenging Covid situation, a food emergency has been declared in Sri Lanka.

item.title: Bhupendra Patel: Why Gujarat chief ministers can't finish their term
item.description: India's ruling BJP party replaced the last two chief ministers just months ahead of state elections.
